answers.answer: Hi...I do take magnesium, but I take it mainly for my IBS issues....mine are 250mg...and is magnesium oxide and when gone will be replaced with the citrate as more of it will be absorbed.....I take 2 pills to get the 400 mg recommended....Did your Dr have you start these? It is possible to take too much.. so do talk with your Dr in regards to what you are taking....." Symptoms of magnesium toxicity include irregular heartbeat, diarrhea, nausea, appetite loss, muscle weakness, very low blood pressure, difficulty breathing and changes in mental state. Magnesium supplements can interact with antibiotics, calcium channel blockers, blood pressure medications, diabetes medication, levothyroxine, anti-malaria drugs and osteoporosis medications."

I am on no other medications at the moment other than the occasional multivit and the doctors havnt suggested these to me. Its been through researching online and forums reading others experiences with them. And asking the pharmacist when I bought them.I am going to start 1 a day for a few days see how they are as ive read they can cause diareha at higher doses

Yes, and that is a indication you have too much in your system,...in fact with my IBS once it gets things moving I stop them as I go from one extreme to the other....but my Dr  is on board with me and how I take them.They can be very helpful with many symptoms we have....

Just taken my first one. I am hoping regular use helps some symptoms and especially my migraines. Ive read nothing but good things from those with migraines.So I am really hopeful :) they are apparently good for anxiety so if that reduces also would be an added bonus because lately ive been riddled with anxiety
I hope they help you as well....but I would feel better if you and your Dr were working on this together....JMHOStay safe and I really hope you see improvement ...keep us posted.
